content:
TITLE: Authenticating with BrowserStack API using cURL
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to authenticate with the BrowserStack API using your username and access key via HTTP Basic Authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -u "username:access_key" https://api.browserstack.com/5
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a New Browser Worker with cURL
DESCRIPTION: Example of creating a new browser worker session by sending a POST request with browser specifications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -u "username:access_key" -X POST -d '{"os":"OS X","os_version":"Mojave","url":"https://browserstack.com","browser":"chrome","browser_version":"75.0"}' https://api.browserstack.com/5/worker -H 'content-type: application/json'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Getting API Status with GET Request
DESCRIPTION: HTTP GET request to check the current status of the API. Returns information about API time usage and parallel worker limits. Authentication is required.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
GET /status
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fetching Available Browsers from BrowserStack
DESCRIPTION: API call to retrieve a list of all available browsers organized by operating system and version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -u "username:access_key" https://api.browserstack.com/5/browsers
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Getting List of Current Workers with GET Request
DESCRIPTION: HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of all current workers with status either 'queue' or 'running'. Authentication is required.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
GET /workers
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Terminating a Browser Worker with DELETE Request
DESCRIPTION: HTTP DELETE request to terminate a browser worker. The worker ID must be provided in the URL path. Authentication is required using username and access key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
DELETE  /worker/<id>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Getting Details of All Browser Workers
DESCRIPTION: API call to retrieve information about all active browser workers in your account, including their status and configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -u "username:access_key" -X GET https://api.browserstack.com/5/workers
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Taking a Screenshot of a Browser Worker
DESCRIPTION: API call to capture a screenshot of the current state of a browser worker session using its ID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -u "username:access_key" https://api.browserstack.com/5/worker/123456789/screenshot.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Making a Request to BrowserStack API Schema Endpoint
DESCRIPTION: Example of making a request to the API schema endpoint with authentication and inspecting the response headers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -i -u "username:access_key" https://api.browserstack.com/5
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Getting Worker Status with GET Request
DESCRIPTION: HTTP GET request to check the status of a specific worker. The worker ID must be provided in the URL path. Authentication is required.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
GET /worker/<id>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample Response for API Status
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript object returned when checking API status. Contains information about used time, available time, running sessions, and session limits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
  {
    used_time: 4235.4,
    total_available_time: 6000,
    running_sessions: 1,
    sessions_limit: 1
  }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fetching Browsers in Flat Structure
DESCRIPTION: API call to retrieve available browsers in a flattened array format instead of the nested structure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -u "username:access_key" https://api.browserstack.com/5/browsers?flat=true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample cURL Command for Getting List of Workers
DESCRIPTION: Bash command using cURL to retrieve a list of all current workers. Authentication credentials must be provided using the -u flag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -u "username:access_key" https://api.browserstack.com/5/workers
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample cURL Command for Getting API Status
DESCRIPTION: Bash command using cURL to check the current status of the API. Authentication credentials must be provided using the -u flag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -u "username:access_key" https://api.browserstack.com/5/status
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample cURL Command for Getting Worker Status
DESCRIPTION: Bash command using cURL to check the status of a worker with ID 123456789. Authentication credentials must be provided using the -u flag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -u "username:access_key" https://api.browserstack.com/5/worker/123456789
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample cURL Command for Terminating a Browser Worker
DESCRIPTION: Bash command using cURL to terminate a browser worker with ID 123456789. Authentication credentials must be provided using the -u flag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -u "username:access_key" -X DELETE https://api.browserstack.com/5/worker/123456789
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Error Response Format for Invalid Requests
DESCRIPTION: Example of an error response when a validation fails, showing the structure of error messages with field and code information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
HTTP/1.1 422 Unprocessable Entity
Content-Length: 136

{
  "message": "Validation Failed",
  "errors": [
    {
      "field": "type",
      "code": "required"
    }
  ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Error Response for API Time Exhaustion
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript object returned when a user has run out of API time. Includes an error message indicating no available API time.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
{
  message: "You have run out of API time"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Browser Worker Creation Response
DESCRIPTION: Example of the response returned when a new browser worker is successfully created, containing the worker ID and URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
{"id":123456789,"url":"https://browserstack.com"}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Successful Worker Creation Response Format
DESCRIPTION: Example of the HTTP response structure when a browser worker is successfully created and initialized.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
HTTP/1.1 200 Success
Content-Type: application/json
X-API-Version: 5

{
  "id": "123456789"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Browser List Response Structure
DESCRIPTION: Example of the nested JSON response returned when querying available browsers, organized by operating system and version with browser details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
{
  'Windows':
    {
      '10':
        [
          {
            "browser": "chrome",
            "browser_version": "83.0"
          },
          {
            "browser": "chrome",
            "browser_version": "84.0"
          },
          {
            "browser": "chrome",
            "browser_version": "85.0 beta"
          },
          {
            "browser": "ie",
            "browser_version": "11.0"
          },
          {
            "browser": "edge",
            "browser_version": "insider preview"
          }...
        ],
    },
  'OS X':
    {
      'Catalina':
        [
          {
            "browser": "chrome",
            "browser_version": "85.0 beta"
          },
          {
            "browser": "edge",
            "browser_version": "85.0 beta"
          },
          {
            "browser": "safari",
            "browser_version": "13.1"
          },
          {
            "browser": "firefox",
            "browser_version": "79.0"
          },
          {
            "browser": "firefox",
            "browser_version": "80.0 beta"
          }...
        ],
      }...
    },
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Flat Browser List Response Structure
DESCRIPTION: Example of the flattened JSON array response returned when querying available browsers with the flat parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
[  
  {
    "os": "Windows",
    "os_version": "10",
    "browser": "chrome",
    "device": null,
    "browser_version": "84.0",
    "real_mobile": null
  },
  {
    "os": "Windows",
    "os_version": "10",
    "browser": "edge",
    "device": null,
    "browser_version": "85.0 beta",
    "real_mobile": null
  },
  {
    "os": "OS X",
    "os_version": "Catalina",
    "browser": "firefox",
    "device": null,
    "browser_version": "79.0",
    "real_mobile": null
  },
  {
    "os": "OS X",
    "os_version": "Catalina",
    "browser": "firefox",
    "device": null,
    "browser_version": "80.0 beta",
    "real_mobile": null
  }....
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample Response for List of Workers
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript array returned when retrieving list of workers. Each element is an object containing details about a worker including status, browser information, and session details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
[
  {
    status: 'running',
    browser: 'ie',
    version: '6.0',
    os: 'Windows',
    os_version: 'XP',
    sessionId: "<sessionId>",
    browser_url: "<dashboard url for the session>"
  },
  {
    status: 'queue',
    device: 'Samsung Galaxy Tab 8.9',
    os: 'android',
    os_version: '2.2',
    sessionId: "<sessionId>",
    browser_url: "<dashboard url for the session>"
  } ...
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Browser Workers List Response Structure
DESCRIPTION: Example of the JSON response showing details of all running and queued browser worker sessions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
[
  {
   "id": "<workerId>",
   "status": "running",
   "os": "OS X",
   "os_version": "Mojave",
   "browser": "chrome",
   "browser_version": "75.0",
   "real_mobile": null,
   "device": null,
   "browser_url": "<dashboard_url_of_the_session>",
   "sessionId": "<sessionId>"
  },
 {
    "id": "<workerId>",
    "status": "queue",
    "os": "android",
    "os_version": "2.2",
    "device": "Samsung Galaxy S",
    "browser": "Android Browser",
    "browser_version": null,
    "real_mobile": false,
    "browser_url": "<dashboard_url_of_the_session>",
    "sessionId": "<sessionId>"
  } ...]

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample Response for Worker Status
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript object returned when checking worker status. Contains information about browser, OS, session ID, and dashboard URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
{
  status: 'running',
  browser: 'ie',
  browser_version: '6.0',
  os: 'Windows',
  os_version: 'XP',
  sessionId: "<sessionId>",
  browser_url: "<dashboard url for the session>"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: API Schema Response Format
DESCRIPTION: Example of the HTTP response structure returned by the BrowserStack API, showing headers and content type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/browserstack/api/blob/v5/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf8
Status: 200 OK
X-API-Version: 5

{}
```
